SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Governance
Smart
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Digital Government and Transparency.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We integrate strategies to improve and optimize public administration and government processes, as well as promote principles of openness and transparency to bring governments, citizens and businesses closer together based on Information and Communication Technologies.

AREA1.TITLE: Participation and inclusion
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Design of a citizen participation plan for decision-making, project development and public policies

AREA1.TITLE: Public and social services
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Integration and interconnection of services with access through comprehensive platforms

AREA1.TITLE: Transparency and access to information
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Development of tools for representation and access to information

AREA2.TITLE: Efficiency in global management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Implementation of information and communication technologies in governments to identify problems and build solutions aligned with real scenarios

AREA2.TITLE: Multi-Level Governance
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Organization of functional areas, facilitating creation of funding programs, regulatory implementation and formation of networks that aggregate demand and allow introduction of innovative services

SERVICE.TITLE: Digital One-Stop Shop
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Development of portals for digitizing procedures (business licenses, property tax, water services), reducing corruption and waiting times.

SERVICE.TITLE: Citizen Participation Platforms
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Apps or portals for Participatory Budgeting and geolocated citizen reports (potholes, broken streetlights).

SERVICE.TITLE: Transparency Dashboards (Open Data)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Open data portals that allow citizens to visualize how public funds are spent (mandatory by law in many states).

SERVICE.TITLE: Government Cybersecurity
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Protection of sensitive data from municipal registries and critical systems.

PROJECTS.TITLE: RANCHO LA COFRADÍA
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Sustainable development project of 68.1 hectares that promotes balanced growth in Tlajomulco. It integrates areas of agriculture, livestock, industry, entertainment, education and infrastructure, using advanced methodologies such as BIM and Lean Construction to strengthen sustainable development goals.

PROJECTS.TITLE: INTEGRATED TECHNOLOGICAL SOLUTIONS PROJECTS
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Turnkey comprehensive project that guarantees connected, secure and operational spaces. We handle the entire process, from design and planning to final delivery, ensuring each system operates optimally from day one. The solution integrates efficient communication networks, access control, video surveillance, power backup and multimedia tools, optimizing daily operations and ensuring continuity during power failures, as well as equipping rooms for in-person or virtual meetings.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Economy
Smart
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Financing and Business Models.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We create development plans that foster the spirit of innovation, creative ability and capacity for change and transformation.

AREA1.TITLE: Innovation
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Creation of measures to promote cooperation between government, businesses and education

AREA1.TITLE: Productivity
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Development of physical and technological infrastructures to optimize productivity

AREA1.TITLE: Interconnectivity
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Creation of business networks and strategies to achieve an online presence

AREA2.TITLE: Labor market flexibility
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Creation of measures to improve labor conditions such as combating unemployment, improving access to the labor market and developing technological proposals

AREA2.TITLE: Entrepreneurship and Start-Ups
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Education, training and creation of environments and infrastructures focused on business support

SERVICE.TITLE: PPP Scheme Management (Public-Private Partnerships)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Consulting to structure projects where private investment recovers capital over the long term

SERVICE.TITLE: ESCO Models (Energy Service Companies)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Implementation of projects that 'pay for themselves' through the savings generated (e.g. LED replacement, energy efficiency in water pumping)

SERVICE.TITLE: Operating and Financial Leasing
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Offering infrastructure as a service (OpEx) to avoid client decapitalization (cameras, lighting, fleets)

SERVICE.TITLE: International Funds Management
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Advisory services to access 'Green Bonds' or funds from organizations such as the IDB or the World Bank for modernization projects

PROJECTS.TITLE: ROSEWOOD RESIDENCES MAYACOBA
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Exclusive residential and tourist development in the Riviera Maya, composed of three large private residences with luxury finishes and custom furnishings. The design integrates materials and details that harmonize with lagoons, golf courses and mangroves, offering privacy and connection with nature. The project combines elegance, comfort and a unique natural environment in a gated community.

PROJECTS.TITLE: XHALATA
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Xhalata is a 16-hectare tourism and real estate development that integrates residences, commercial spaces and wellness areas in harmony with the natural environment. Inspired by the UN SDGs, it incorporates renewable energy, water management, reforestation and biodiversity protection. It promotes an inclusive and resilient community focused on tourism and sustainable development.

Smart

AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Supervision of environmental conditions and the state of distribution networks.

AREA1.TITLE: Energy efficiency
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Optimization of energy consumption to reduce costs and emissions.

AREA1.TITLE: Urban planning and building rehabilitation
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Design and improvement of urban spaces and recovery of existing infrastructure.

AREA2.TITLE: Waste management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive waste handling to minimize environmental impact.

AREA2.TITLE: Environmental protection
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Actions to preserve ecosystems and natural resources.

SERVICE.TITLE: ESG Consulting (Environmental, Social, and Governance)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Helping industrial parks and cities comply with regulations to attract foreign investment.

SERVICE.TITLE: Water Management (Smart Water)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Telemetry for wells and water network sectorization to detect non-visible leaks (critical amid Mexico’s water crisis).

SERVICE.TITLE: Net Zero Strategy
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: GHG (Greenhouse Gas) emissions inventory and decarbonization plans.

SERVICE.TITLE: Air Quality Monitoring
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Environmental sensor networks to automatically activate contingency protocols.

SERVICE.TITLE: Smart Waste Management
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Fill-level sensors in containers and route optimization to reduce fuel consumption.

PROJECTS.TITLE: TEPOZTLÁN
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Sustainable real estate development of 9.7 hectares that integrates 68 homes with low environmental impact design. The project applies LEED principles, water reuse, renewable energy and modular construction. Inspired by the SDGs, it includes wellness spaces, bike lanes and sports areas, as well as commercial and community areas that promote social cohesion and respect local identity.

PROJECTS.TITLE: HACIENDA CAPULÍN
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Residential and tourist development of 66 luxury apartments that combines conscious design and sustainability, aligned with the UN SDGs. Integrated into a privileged natural setting, it preserves century-old trees and maintains historic architecture. Offers amenities such as a pool, padel courts, jacuzzi and restaurant. Uses technologies and sustainable practices to optimize resources and minimize environmental impact.

ABOUT.LABEL: Smart City.
ABOUT.TEXT1: A holistic system where human and social capital interact, using solutions based on ICTs.
ABOUT.TITLE2: The purpose of a Smart City is to achieve efficient management
ABOUT.TEXT2: satisfying the needs of the city and its citizens.
ABOUT.TITLE3: Consulting and advice on smart city management
ABOUT.TEXT3: National and international services with an ethical, sustainable and innovative approach.

CONTACT_FORM.HEADING: Contact us if you have questions or comments on the subject, or register to receive more information about smart cities.

INFORMATION.MISSION_TEXT: To devise intelligent solutions for the technological and sustainable development of cities and communities, always seeking the inclusion and accessibility of people.
INFORMATION.VISION_TEXT: To develop and create city and human settlement projects worldwide, which promote inclusiveness and guarantee accessibility, security, resource optimization, affordability and sustainability to achieve prosperity and quality of life.

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Smart City – Smart Communities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
OM Smart Technology & Consulting supports the management and implementation processes of solutions based on ISO standards.

These allow for an objective evaluation of the development of sustainable cities and communities, through process standardization and qualitative and quantitative analysis.
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT: The International Organization for Standardization, through its Technical Committee 268 for sustainable cities and communities, has developed the following Standards in this field of application.

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable development in communities – Management System for Sustainable Development
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
Its main goals are:

  • Build consensus on sustainable development
  • Improve sustainability, smartness, and resilience of all actions
  • Develop cross-sectoral, multidisciplinary approaches, life-cycle value, and total costing
  • Promote synergies
  • Increase efficiency and attractiveness of communities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Scope:

  • Applicable to communities of all sizes, structures, and types
  • Applicable to developed and developing countries
  • Applicable at local, regional, or national levels
  • Applicable in urban or rural areas

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable development of communities – Indicators for city services and quality of life
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
This standard complements the series of indicators to measure community performance; it includes city services and quality of life in smart and resilient cities.

These indicators allow evaluation and planning based on possible future needs and establish as main goals:

  • Measurement of service performance management and quality over time
  • Possibility of comparison to learn about performance measures
  • Policy development and priority setting
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Scope:

  • Indicators applicable to very large administrative areas
  • Applicable to evaluating city resource efficiency
  • Together with other indicators, it allows for a more comprehensive and holistic approach to sustainability analysis

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable cities and communities – Indicators for Smart Cities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
Provides a benchmark for the sustainability of cities, which require additional indicators beyond those established to evaluate city services and quality of life. Together with the application of ISO 37120, it helps cities implement policies, programs, and projects for smart cities.

Scope:

Together with ISO 37120, it specifies providing a complete set of indicators to measure progress toward a smart city.
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Its goals are:

  • Apply collaborative leadership methods
  • Use data and technologies to improve services and quality of life
  • Provide a better living environment through smart policies and making technologies available to citizens
  • Generate innovative solutions to environmental and sustainability issues
  • Identify needs and benefits of smart infrastructures
  • Facilitate innovation and growth
  • Build a dynamic and innovative economy that can be resilient

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable Cities and Communities – Indicators for Resilient Cities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
A resilient city is able to prepare for, recover from, and adapt to shocks and stresses. This standard, together with the indicators set out in ISO 37120, enables the evaluation of Resilient Cities and also the implementation of actions to manage and mitigate human and natural stress related to environmental degradation and economic instability that cause persistent negative impacts.

It presents specific indicators and also structured indicators according to a risk management and disaster management process; monitoring compliance with Sustainable Development Goals and structured in accordance with the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction. These aim to help cities:
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
• Prepare for, recover from, and adapt to shocks and stresses
  • Generate learning based on performance measure comparison and sharing of best practices


Scope:

  • Applicable for measuring resilience in cities
  • Applicable to any city, municipality, or local government
  • Applicable regardless of size or location
